name: Cambridge Suites Hotel

reviews.text: Just like all the reviews read clean & helpful staff. Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Awesome place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed for five nights and very much enjoyed ourselves. I've read recent reviews and found them generally congruent with our experiences.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was spacious and clean. Continental breakfast was very good.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Everyone loved the hotel - too bad we are not going back to Toronto in the near future
reviews.text: The hotel restaurant (Portico) was very good. Parking was easy if a bit pricey ($22 per night). Wi-fi was free for our particular suite package but it was painfully slow (except in the lobby) and we are unsure of the security features employed by the hotel (someone tried to hack his email account). The exercise room/hot tub/sauna were great. The hotel also has a few bikes that you can sign out and ride around town!
Staff were very friendly and helpful (Andy was particularly positive). Located in the heart of Toronto, I'd stay here again and again.
reviews.title: Great for family travel!
Best bang for your buck in Toronto
reviews.text: If your are looking for the best bang for your buck hotel in downtown Toronto, then Cambridge Suites is the place for you. The rooms are huge with a separate bedroom and living room. There’s a kitchenette complete with sink, fridge, and even dishes and cutlery. There is a bathroom/dressing room with nice toiletries. Every night you get complimentary bottle of water, popcorn, cookies, chocolate and a card detailing the weather for the next day. There’s even a complimentary continental breakfast which serves coffee/tea, juices, fresh fruit, pastries, cereal, yogurt, etc. No hot eggs or waffles, but it’s more than enough to get you started each day.

reviews.title: A winner
reviews.text: The best part of this hotel is its location. It’s located right in downtown Toronto in the financial district. I was here on business, so getting to work only took a 5min walk. Eaton Centre is only 1 block away. If you get sick of the many food courts, there are lots of places to eat on Yonge and Queen.
The only negative I have is that there’s no pool. There is a Jacuzzi, but it’s very small and it’s in the same room as the small gym and sauna.
reviews.title: Meets expectations

reviews.text: This is a great place to stay for business travelers and I would also stay here if I was just visiting Toronto.
reviews.title: Cambridge Suites, one of the best

likes.liked: — The Staff, location and room size

reviews.text: I reserved via Hotwire for a really good price (approx $100 cdn) for a very nice suite in the heart of downtown Toronto.
reviews.title: Very Nice Downtown Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The suite was spacious and very comfortable. The bathroom was divided so that the tub and toilet were in one room and the sink area had a huge dressing area with lots of counter space. The suite had two closets and lots of drawers. There were two flat screen televisions. The living room had a wet bar with a nice size refrigerator. The ice machines were centrally located. The staff at the Cambridge Suites were so friendly, and helpful. The hotel seemed to be in a quiet location. At first we were not sure that we had booked a place to stay in the right area of Toronto. It was in an area that was an easy walk to many places.
reviews.title: Great comfortable place to stay!

reviews.text: This is a very well run suite hotel with a friendly and helpful staff. It is situated in the financial district and as such is convenient via walking, subway and/or trolley to most of the tourist attractions. The suites are spacious, quiet and include a separate bedroom. The living room has a comfortable pullout sofa, a microwave and a refrigerator. The cityscape rate includes free internet connection and continental breakfast for not much additional cost. A great choice for parents and children or grandparents and grand children. Ask the staff for restaurant recommendations.
reviews.title: Great choice for families

reviews.text: back from business trip to Toronto, Stayed at cambridge for 5 nights. It was comfortable, bed was nice and comfy. Room spacious and adequate
reviews.title: was good hotel recommend it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: te, Free Wi Fi if needed. Cleaned daily and towels replaced daily if needed. Would highly recommend it, Value wise was superb
reviews.title: Fully recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If in Toronto and looking for a nice hotel where staff are friendly and helpful, then stay here
reviews.title: COMFORT, QUALITY, LOCATION & STYLE
Loved Cambridge Suites
reviews.text: Found Cambridge Suites online and because of excellent reviews, decided to stay there. We arrived 15 minutes before our dinner reservations at Ruth's Chris Steak house (would highly recommend as well!) and the reception staff was very friendly, quick to check us in and helpful in getting us to the restaurant on time. A free shuttle was called for us immediately and we made our reservation with time to spare. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. We enjoyed the complimentary snacks in the room and the bottled water and chocolates delivered to us in the evening. These are just a few of the nice touches that this hotel has to offer. We paid $149 CDN and we felt that that was excellent value for our money as we have paid much more money for hotels not nearly as nice and clean as this one.

I believe this is an all-suite hotel, and we were in one of the smaller suites. It was absolutely beautiful. The amenities were plentiful and happily replenished as often as we requested, as well as on their regular daily routine. The staff was consistently friendly, warm, and helpful.
reviews.title: Home away from home

likes.liked: — Hard to narrow down. Everything was lovely.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As this was just before Christmas the hotel was decorated throughout all public areas, and the lobby was a joy to pass through, with an elegantly-decorated tree.
reviews.title: Excellent value, great location and really nice staff
Customer Service and Festive Smiles
reviews.text: The location could not have been better, both for business and pleasure. We were short walking distance from where we were doing business, as well as being very close to the Eaton Centre.

The bar staff went above and beyond in hospitality. I wish I had written this immediately after the trip when my memory was clearer, as there was one member of the bar staff, a woman whose name I can't now recall, who made me feel as if I was simultaneously their best customer and her best friend.
reviews.title: Great location, value, service

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights in Oct. Fast check-in, with 3 people on staff.
reviews.title: Spacious and comfortable room, great location

reviews.text: What a treat to enter my room and find a real suite. Good layout, too, w/ the bed in the back, buffering any sound from the hallways.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: A glorious bed with 4 down pillows. En suite bathroom, w/ a long marble counter and changing space, leading to the bathroom. Some of the doors open awkwardly, like the bathroom door that banged into the toilet and the closet door that banged into another open one. Not a big deal but you had to always close 1 door before opening another.
reviews.title: Great Location!
First Class Hotel.
reviews.text: In the living area, a wet bar with marble countertop, sink, coffeemaker and mini-fridge. Although I could not find the promised free popcorn. Hmmmm...

Complimentary breakfast can be ordered in. Wonderful not to change and fix my hair just to go down to breakfast. However, on both days they messed up my order, forgetting juice altogether and mixing up the muffin choices.
reviews.title: Wonderful Weekend!

reviews.text: The rooms are very well appointed, beds are comfortable, room are clean, nice to have bar fridge and microwave and kuerig coffeemaker. Continental breakfast was adequate.
reviews.title: We stayed here two times in a row and it was great both stays. We will definitely come back.

reviews.text: Hotel staff awesome, very very friendly, extremely helpful and always going out of their way for you.
reviews.title: Feels like home - everytime

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, within walking distance to may restaurants, Eaton Centre and cabs always available.
reviews.title: A perfect hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel very accomadating, let us have early and late checkout,so baby could nap didn't charge us any extra.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, would definitely stay there again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks. Cambridge Suites
reviews.title: Good location, clean and spacious

reviews.text: I have to say that having stayed at the Cambridge Suites in July '05, I am very surprised at all the bad press it seems to be getting! (oh, and I can assure everyone that I don't work for the Hotel, am not it's owner and have absolutely NO reason to lie!).
reviews.title: Genuinelty surprised by all the negative feedback....

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel as our 1st stop of our Honeymoon. We arrived at 2am and the receptionist was very attentive, knew who we were immediately and was very helpful. We were shown to our room which was of a good size and very clean. I have to admit I didnt check the carpets in detail however I would have thought that after 3 night stay I would have probably notived had they been that dirty!
reviews.title: Just right
Disappointing
reviews.text: We're not the most demanding of guests so I can't really speak for the levels of service when something is requested however we did ask for a wake up call which was on time and at all times the hotel staff were very welcoming and helpful.

reviews.title: disappointing hotel
reviews.text: I would have no hesitation in recommending the Cambridge Suites however I can only speak for the room we stayed in which again, was more than satisfactory.

Stayed at the Cambridge Suites for two days on our way out West and for another night on the way back to the UK. It was "just like home" and the suite felt less like a hotel than many places I've stayed. It was really nice being able to completeley shut off the bedroom area. Also the breakfast (which we'd expected to be just a few rolls and coffee) was excellent. and the location...well that couldn't be better. Would definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: Just what we wanted

reviews.text: Comfortable Suite Hotel.Rooms are furnished with coffeemaker, useful microwave and small fridge and some cutlery,plates,bowls and cups - also kettle and toaster available on request.Helpful,efficient, friendly staff and unobtrusive maid service.
reviews.title: Comfortable at the Cambridge Suites

reviews.text: Continental buffet breakfast is fine but this finishes at 9am on weekday mornings which seems a little early and sometimes there are queues from 8.15am and the staff may have problems with keeping things stocked.Guests are allowed to take breakfast on a tray to their room.
reviews.title: good hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lots of green apples available for guests each morning in the corridors and reception( only green ones ).
reviews.title: Nothing to rave about

reviews.text: View of the city from exercise room is lovely.
reviews.title: Top notch!

reviews.text: We would be quite happy to stay here again.
reviews.title: Loved the Cambridge suites.
Beautiful hotel
reviews.text: My family and I recently stayed at the CS hotel.
Upon arrival we were upgraded to a CityScape suite which was a bonus.
reviews.title: Thanksgiving weekend
Lives up to its reviews
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights in room 1906, from which we had a great view of the Old City Hall, plus the many 'mirrored' skyscrapers in downtown T.O which looked beautiful as the sun set.
The Suite was well-laid out and well-maintained.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: The two Queen beds in the bedroom were supremely comfortable and the bed-linen was gorgeous.
reviews.title: A Great Find - would definitely return!

reviews.text: The Cambridge Suites hotel was a very reasonably priced hotel and the accommodations were very nice. Having a separate sink outside the bathroom is a helpful touch so that one person can be showering while the other has access to a sink/mirror. The suite itelf was good size, comfortable, furnishings above average and in good condition. The location was in walking distance to a number of places including the St. Lawrence Market.
reviews.title: Good hotel for the price
Location, Location, Location!
reviews.text: Myself and my travel companions kindly got picked up at Toronto Airport in a stretched limo 'hummer' (this nice surprise was supplied by a family member over there).

reviews.title: Cambridge Suites
reviews.text: Whilst three of us got out at the Radisson, myself and my girlfriend had booked a room for the same price at the Cambridge Suites.

The room was spacious and airy with a decent view of downtown TO. There were seperate rooms for the living room, bedroom, and bathroom which made the room feel like a mini-apartment. There were two tv's and a huge sink / mirrored area specially designed for girls (Well, I sure didn't need all that sink / mirror space!).
reviews.title: Really liked this hotel. Good location
Great Stay
reviews.text: The minibar was expensive (as with any hotel), and the continental breakfast they brought to the room was less than filling (I had to eat as soon as we left the hotel).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a Christmas trip in Dec. Hotel is in a great location and the staff we encountered were really friendly. The suite was fine - we had a very high floor which gave us a good view. Given it was COLD and snowy in Toronto, the rooms were warm and welcoming. After 4 days the complimentary breakfast, which doesn't change, was a bit boring. Quality was OK but nothing special. Hotel restaurant has a nice atmosphere.
reviews.title: Good location, nice staff, a little bit dated

reviews.text: Housekeeping could have been a bit more thorough with the hoovering and dusting but overall the room was clean (included the somewhat dated bathroom) The king-sized Bed was very comfortable. We appreciated a complimentary bottle of wine which was delivered after we had checked in.
reviews.title: Very good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would choose this hotel again - its not a luxury hotel but it does represent good value for money.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: The micro brewery opposite was VERY enjoyable and served great food and beer - ideal if you are tired after a day's sightseeing. Also liked the old brewery area and the Christmas Market.
reviews.title: Great Service at the Cambridge!
Comfortable with many perks - and definitely a "green" hotel!!
reviews.text: I found this place here on tripadvisor, and given good reviews, decided to try. I called them directly, got great service, and a good rate.

I stayed at this hotel while attending a large meeting at the Conference Centre. While the conference provided buses from this and other hotels, it was more efficient to do the 15-20 minute walk back and forth. This walk, incidentally, can be done underground and inside buildings the whole way if you are there during bad weather. It is not the most convenient hotel for the Conference Centre but definitely convenient to what appears to be the "Times Square" of Toronto, the area near Queen and Yonge, where there is the best shopping and other tourist venues. It is close to the Hockey Hall of Fame and a reasonable walk to the theater district. I did not experience any of the problems some other reviewers complained about. I believe this hotel has undergone substantial renovation recently. My room was immaculate, the bed quite comfortable, the two TVs fine, and no odor of smoke and certainly no mold. The check-in was quick and service friendly. I did not find the elevators particularly slow. Though I was above the 10th floor but below the more expensive rooms at the top of the building, there was some unadvoidable traffic noise from the street, but not too bothersome. I was on the street side of the hotel away from the neighboring building. Those who hate all noise can ask to have the trade-off of being in a quieter room on the side next to the neighboring building. The view on the street side is not all that nice anyway--just some city streets--so you aren't missing much if you get the blocked view some others have mentioned. Others complained about the small lobby--so what? Who wants to spend time in the lobby when there is a nice suite to spend time in? I'd rather the hotel spend its money on the rooms than a fancy lobby that one is likely just to pass through. There is a nice large hot tub and a small fitness center on the top floor, I for one prefer this to a pool anyway. The breakfast room is too small to handle all the guests if the hotel is full, and to compensate for this you can ask to have free delivery of breakfast to your room, a clever way for the hotel to get around this problem. Breakfast was okay, fairly standard fare. The Eaton Centre has a nice market where you can buy take-out food to heat in your room's microwave and store in the refrigerator for an evening you want to relax inside the suite. Parking is an extra $16; across the street was a cheaper parking lot, but I preferred the safety of my car inside a garage. I am a very experienced traveler and have had rooms as nice as this one elsewhere. I was satisfied with everything but the price and the fact that internet was an extra $10 for 24 hrs rather than being included. Our conference organization did not do a very good job negotiating prices with any of the Toronto hotels; I could have gotten a better price by calling the hotel directly instead of booking through the conference at what was supposedly good rates. I would stay here at another trip to Toronto if I could get a good price on this hotel (though if I was attending a conference, I'd aim to be closer to the Centre next time; those hotels were already booked, however).
reviews.title: Nice suite hotel in a good location

likes.disliked: — price and extra charges, distance to Conference Centre

reviews.text: Thanks Trip Advisor! Based on your reviews - we booked this hotel and we had a great experience! We would definately stay here again when we go back to Toronto. We stayed in the Cityview suite....great view, comfortable and clean accommodations in the downtown area. Would definately recommend!
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: I would stay here again. You feel like you have your own apartment in the city.
reviews.title: Comfortable place in the heart of Toronto
Very nice place
reviews.text: Location: This is a great location for sightseeing in Toronto -- very centrally located. It was a bit further to the Convention Center than I liked (a 15 minute walk at a very brisk pace).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: The rooms were huge -- with a separate large bedroom and living area (each with its own TV). The bed was firm and comfortable. The kitchenette with complimentary tea, hot cocoa, coffee, cookies, microwave popcorn and real cups/utensils was a nice touch. There are two robes for your use as well. In business center, you can print things for free (off of a USB, but you pay for the internet). The staff were courteous, friendly, and helpful. Free continental breakfast was nice. The food available was just average -- but they did have good variety (various juices, coffee, yogurt, cereal, dried fruit, bagels, bread, pasteries). It was definitely enough to start your day. And even if you showed up 15 minutes before the breakfast ended, they still had a full selection (it was constantly replenished).
reviews.title: Loved the Cambridge

likes.disliked: — No free internet access in the rooms

description: Voted as one of Canada's top 25 hotels, an all suite property that offers space and privacy; French doors separate the bedroom from the living room with free high-speed internet access. Each suite boasts an entertainment wet bar (kitchenette) with a coffee maker, fridge and microwave; as an extension of the bathroom, we offer a private dressing area and 24 hour room service is available as part of Portico restaurant's dining experience. Hotel guests also have access to the Business Centre plus access to the penthouse level Fitness Centre featuring a breathtaking view of the City. The hotel is connected to Toronto's underground PATH, which affords the business and leisure traveller with a well lit, secured walking corridor to over 5,000 companies and shops such as the Eaton Centre. Going to the theatre? Three of Toronto's best are within two blocks of the hotel! Looking for your place in the city? You found it!
